item.title: ICE Raids Are Driving Customers Away From L.A. Restaurants, But We Can Still Save Them
item.description:
How is this one of the toughest years for food businesses in a generation at the exact same time Latino culture is having its biggest, loudest, most mainstream moment in American history? Instead, restaurants, many of which are Mexican—the heart of that culture, the vanguard—are barely hanging on.

item.title: All-Indigenous Art Exhibit in San Pedro Celebrates Native Women as Knowledge-Keepers
item.description:
One of the artists featured, Eve-Lauryn Little Shell LaFountain, created a nude self-portrait of her first pregnancy, juxtaposed with ledger paper. The show addresses colonialism’s impact, motherhood, and the crisis of “Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women” (MMIW), while also celebrating individual stories of resilience and survival.

item.source:markdown: After their more typical wood-framed homes burned, some are now rebuilding with non-combustible materials. And they’re getting discounts from insurance companies.

item.title: Fullerton police say ICE agent pulled gun on woman recording him in Santa Ana
item.description: The department said it did not "assist" the agent in enforcement, and that no crime occurred.

item.title: Updating your name and gender on CA, federal IDs: What to know after SCOTUS’ passport ruling

item.title: Meet Porkchop, the Aquarium of the Pacific's rescued green sea turtle
item.description: Also meet the Long Beach aquarium's new CEO, who says the aquarium is expanding conservation efforts, including with sea turtles and zebra sharks.

item.title: As tuition keeps increasing, UC students want a bigger say on the Board of Regents
item.description: To increase student representation, UC student leaders are pushing for the second seat to also have voting power.

item.title: Trump floats tariff 'dividends' even while plan shows major flaws
item.description: President Donald Trump says the government will distribute checks to Americans from tariff revenue. Here's what that could mean.

item.title: California schools now offer free preschool for 4-year-olds. Here's what kids really learn in it
item.description: California has made a new grade, transitional kindergarten, available for all four-year-olds. LAist reporters spent a day in three schools to find out what students do in class.

item.title: Health care costs jump to the fore as candidates jockey to be California governor
item.description: With the contest a year away, polling shows voters want the next governor to minimize out-of-pocket health care costs, increase mental health care, and expand caregiving services.

item.title: With an upcoming vote in the House, an end to the shutdown is in sight
item.description: After 41 days of a government shutdown, the U.S. Senate passed a set of bills to reopen the government. The House comes back to vote as early as Wednesday afternoon.

item.title: Prominent Afrikaners refuse to be 'pawns,' and hit back at Trump's claims about South Africa

item.title: CalOptima issues $8 million in emergency funding for hungry seniors, low-income households

item.title: California Supreme Court strikes down warning on LAPD citizen complaint forms
